thread.title: Child pulled from pond, flown to Seattle Children’s
thread.title_full: Child pulled from pond, flown to Seattle Children’s | The Seattle Times

author: Dominic Gates
title: Child pulled from pond, flown to Seattle Children’s
text:
A 2-year-old boy was airlifted to Seattle Children’s by helicopter Saturday afternoon from Hansville in Kitsap County after nearly drowning in a pond, officials said.
Kitsap County Sheriff’s spokesman Scott Wilson said that by Saturday evening the boy was recovering and doing fine.
Wilson said the boy got out of the house near Hood Canal without his parents noticing. When a sibling ran inside to tell the father that the boy was in the water, the father pulled him out and tried to resuscitate him.
A neighbor called 911 at 4:25 p.m. and North Kitsap Fire & Rescue arrived soon after to take over.

Wilson said the sheriff’s office has closed its investigation.
Dominic Gates: 206-464-2963 or dgates@seattletimes.com
